subject: Critical Thinking
title: No True Scotsman: Moving the Goalposts
description: A quick, practical guide to No True Scotsman: Moving the Goalposts.

hook.text: 'No Scotsman puts sugar in his porridge.' 'Angus does.' 'Well, no TRUE Scotsman puts sugar in his porridge.'

buildup.text: No True Scotsman: redefining a group to exclude counterexamples rather than accepting that the claim was wrong.

twist.text: You see it everywhere: 'Real Christians don't do that.' 'A true patriot would never...' The definition shifts to win.

punchline.text: If you keep changing the definition, you aren't making an argument.

quiz.question: What is the 'No True Scotsman' fallacy?
options: Redefining a group to exclude counterexamples rather than accepting the claim was wrong
